titles.title: California Federal Milk Marketing Order Act
To provide for the inclusion of the State of California as a separate Federal milk marketing order upon the petition and approval of California dairy producers of such inclusion.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Livestock, Rural Development, and Credit.

bill.summary:
3/21/2013--Introduced. California Federal Milk Marketing Order Act - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture (USDA), upon the petition and approval of California dairy producers, to designate California as a separate federal milk marketing order.
Provides that if so designated, the order covering California shall have the right to reblend and distribute order receipts to recognize quota value.
